context: Large electric utility (5M customers, $12B revenue) facing state renewable energy mandates requiring 50% renewable generation by 2030. Current renewable mix: 25%.

request.purpose: Accelerate renewable energy buildout including 2GW solar, 1GW wind, and 500MW battery storage over 5 years
request.justification: State mandate deadline approaching; current pace will miss 2030 target; rising fossil fuel costs making renewables competitive

decision_process.outcome: Identified optimal mix of solar, wind, and storage; projected $2B savings vs. fossil fuel alternatives
Strong community support with conditions; developed comprehensive transition program for fossil fuel workers
Regulatory approval granted with performance incentives and community benefits requirements
Approved $6B initial investment with remaining $2B contingent on technology cost reductions

lessons_learned: Early community engagement essential for infrastructure projects; integrated planning across technical, regulatory, and social dimensions critical for success
